{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3650914,"name":"Guilherme Samuel","username":"megarubber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/megarubber/{size}/172063_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-11T14:36:52.055Z","cooked":"

I watched the FUN Rewind about the history of control system and I cloned a 2006 robot code repository into my machine, and I found it so interesting that I started comparing the old vs. new control system and programming techniques.

Following this line, I would like to know if someone knows any of good resources on the history of control system over the years.

The first thing that comes into my mind is the 358’s resources page, which shows a timeline and a bit of past years.

I’ve archived all the code I published for FRC at kevin.org/frc. It dates back to 2004. I need to install an updated certificate for my domain, so it your browser freaks out because it thinks something nefarious is happening, just click through.

For anyone not familiar with who Kevin Watson is he is the foundation of so much code in frc, it’s ridiculous!
When I made the decision many years ago to learn to code for frc, Kevin was where I turned 95% percent of the time.

Kevin, it so nice to see your smiling face again!
